bestBHT.bht: He saved others, himself he cannot save. These mocking words uttered at the crucifixion reveal a lack of understanding about the true purpose of Jesus' sacrifice. Unbeknownst to them, Jesus willingly chose not to save himself, demonstrating the depths of his love and the greatness of his mission. Their mistaken perception that his inability to save himself proved his unworthiness as the Messiah overlooked the selflessness and surrender to God's will that characterized Jesus' actions.

John Gill: Having gained their point, and satiated their revenge on him.
Who were likewise his implacable enemies.
He saved others, himself he cannot save.

bhtAttempts.bht: He saved others, himself he cannot save. These words uttered by the mockers at the crucifixion reflect their failure to understand the true significance of Jesus' sacrifice. In their ignorance, they saw Jesus' inability to save himself as proof that he was not the Messiah. However, what they failed to grasp was that Jesus willingly chose not to save himself in order to save others. His act of selflessness and surrendering to God's will demonstrated the depth of his love and the magnitude of his mission to redeem humanity.

The mockers at the crucifixion sneered, He saved others, himself he cannot save. While these words reveal their ignorance, they also echo a profound truth. Jesus willingly chose not to save himself, for his selflessness and surrender to God's will were the very reasons he came to Earth. Their failure to recognize the significance of his sacrifice highlights the depths of his love and the magnitude of his mission to redeem humanity.

He saved others, himself he cannot save. These mocking words uttered at the crucifixion reveal a lack of understanding about the true purpose of Jesus' sacrifice. Unbeknownst to them, Jesus willingly chose not to save himself, demonstrating the depths of his love and the greatness of his mission. Their mistaken perception that his inability to save himself proved his unworthiness as the Messiah overlooked the selflessness and surrender to God's will that characterized Jesus' actions.

He saved others, himself he cannot save. The mocking words spoken by the crucifiers misconstrue the deeper meaning of Jesus' sacrifice. Their failure to comprehend that Jesus willingly chose not to save himself reflects their ignorance of his selfless love and divine mission. Instead of recognizing his act of surrender to God's will, they mistakenly regarded his vulnerability as a sign of weakness. Little did they know that Jesus' decision not to save himself was a powerful display of his purpose to save others and bring redemption to humanity.

He saved others, himself he cannot save. These mocking words spoken at the crucifixion demonstrate a fundamental misunderstanding of Jesus' sacrifice. Their failure to grasp that Jesus willingly chose not to save himself reveals their ignorance of his selfless love and ultimate mission. Instead of recognizing his act of surrender to God's will, they erroneously interpreted his vulnerability as a sign of weakness. Little did they know, Jesus' decision not to save himself was a profound testament to his purpose of saving others and offering redemption to humanity.
